alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 9:43AM PST until December 05 at 9:14PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Bogachiel River Near La Push affecting Clallam County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Chehalis River Above Doty affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain will continue in the Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 1 to 3 inches of rain is forecast before the rain rates ease. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including La Push, McDonald Bridge, Sequim, Potlatch, Satsop, Montesano...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the South West Region...including Mud Mtn. Dam Outflow, R Street Bridge, South Prairie, Fairfax, Orting, Puyallup, National, McKenna, Rainier, Packwood, Randle, Mayfield Dam...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Bucoda, Centralia, Chehalis, Doty, Centralia, Grand Mound, Porter...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Doty. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 318.0 feet, flood waters of the upper Chehalis and South Fork Chehalis will inundate many roads and some residential and commercial areas. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Curtis Hill...Lake Creek...Moon Hill...Wildwood Roads in the Boisfort Valley and Labri Rd. and Front St. below Doty. This stage roughly corresponds to just below Phase 2 in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 318.1 feet. - Flood stage is 318.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM PST Tuesday was 318.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 318.3 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 545 PM PST.
